ul.li1: 121 He who loves discipline loves knowledge,
ul.li2: but he who hates rebuke is stupid.
ul.li1: 2The good obtains favor from Yahweh,
ul.li2: but anyone who schemes, he condemns.
ul.li1: 3A person will not be established by wickedness,
ul.li2: but the root of the righteous will not be moved.
ul.li1: 4A woman of strengthOr “honor” is the crown of her master,Or “lord, owner”
ul.li2: but like rot in his bones is she who brings shame.
ul.li1: 5The thoughts of the righteous areHebrew “is” just;
ul.li2: the advice of the wicked is treacherous.
ul.li1: 6The words of the wicked are an ambush of blood,
ul.li2: but the mouth of the upright delivers them.
ul.li1: 7The wicked are overthrown and are no more,Literally “there is no them”
ul.li2: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
ul.li1: 8For his mouth of good sense, a man will be recommended,
ul.li2: but he who is of perverse mindLiterally “heart” will be despised.
ul.li1: 9It is better to be lowly and a servant to someoneLiterally “for him,” “belonging to him”
ul.li2: than self-glorifying and lacking food.
ul.li1: 10The righteous knows the lifeOr “soul,” or “inner self” of his animal,
ul.li2: but the compassionHebrew “compassions” of the wicked is cruel.
ul.li1: 11He who works his land will have plenty of food,
ul.li2: but he who follows worthless things lacks sense.Literally “heart”
ul.li1: 12The wicked covets the proceeds of evil,
ul.li2: but the root of the righteous bears fruit.Literally “gives, sets up”
ul.li1: 13By the transgression of lips, evil is ensnared,
ul.li2: but the righteous escapes from trouble.
ul.li1: 14From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he is filled with good,
ul.li2: and the reward of a man’s laborLiterally “the hands of a man” will return to him.
ul.li1: 15The way of a fool is upright in his own eyes,
ul.li2: but he who listens to advice is wise.
ul.li1: 16As for a fool, on that very dayLiterally “on the day” he makes his anger known,
ul.li2: but he who ignores an insult is prudent.
ul.li1: 17He who will speak truth will reveal righteousness,
ul.li2: but the witness of falsehood, deceit.
ul.li1: 18There is one who speaks rashly, like the thrust of a sword,
ul.li2: but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
ul.li1: 19A lip of truth endures forever,
ul.li2: but a tongue of deception lasts only a moment.
ul.li1: 20Deceit is in the heartOr “mind” of those who planLiterally “the planners of” evil,
ul.li2: but to those who planLiterally “the planners of” peace, there is joy.
ul.li1: 21No evil will happenLiterally “All evil will not happen” to the righteous,
ul.li2: but the wicked are filled with trouble.
ul.li1: 22An abomination of Yahweh are lips of deceit,
ul.li2: but they who act faithfully are his delight.
ul.li1: 23A clever person conceals knowledge,
ul.li2: but the heartOr “mind” of a foolHebrew “fools” announces folly.
ul.li1: 24The hand of the diligent ones will rule,
ul.li2: but the lazy will belong to forced labor.
ul.li1: 25Anxiety in the heartOr “mind” of a man will weigh him down,
ul.li2: but a good word will cheer him.
ul.li1: 26A righteous person will seek out his neighbor,
ul.li2: but the way of the wicked will lead them astray.
ul.li1: 27The lazy will not roast his game,
ul.li2: but diligence is the precious wealth of a man.
ul.li1: 28On the road of righteousness is life,
ul.li2: and on the way of the path, may there be no death.
